conclusion: Determine the maximum force F to keep block A from sliding off block B.
Block A is on top of block B, and a force F is applied horizontally to block B.
Maximum static friction force between A and B is 1 N, and kinetic friction coefficient between B and ground is 0.1.
Maximum static friction force for block A is 1 N.
Coefficient of kinetic friction for block B is 0.1.
Combined mass of blocks A and B is 3 kg.
Normal force on the ground due to both blocks is 30 N.
Kinetic friction force on block B is 3 N.
Net force on block B is F - 3 N.
Block A's acceleration is due to static friction.
Static friction provides force to accelerate block A: 1 N = 1 kg * a_A.
Maximum force F to keep A and B stationary is 5 N.
